articles.title: A locked door and myriad treasures beyond, in vast rooms deemed unusable at Boston Public Library
articles.description:
The resplendence of the Boston Public Library’s McKim Building unfolds with each step up the grand staircase. Past the imposing stone lions, the golden-hued stairwell gives way to an airy gallery of murals, a millennium-spanning celebration of the muses. Nearby, a narrower stairway leads to the hushed third floor, where people wander the opulent gallery […]

The post A locked door and myriad treasures beyond, in vast rooms deemed unusable at Boston Public Library appeared first on Boston.com.
